This question requires knowledge about how light interacts with objects and our perception of color. When light hits an object, it can be absorbed, reflected, or refracted. Refraction occurs when light passes through a medium, such as a shoe, and changes direction. This can cause the light to be bent and split into different colors, resulting in the perception of different colors when viewed from different angles or under different lighting conditions.

This bending of light can cause a shift in the perceived colors of the object. Options (A), (B), and (D) are unrelated to the phenomenon described in the question.
